intro: Schoenobiblus grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered broom, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flower heads that are composed of many small florets. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
